pages.text: “And do not be arrogant as against God, for I come to you with clear authority
“For me, I have sought safety with my Lord and your Lord, against your injuring me
“If you do not believe, at least keep away from me.”
Then he cried to his Lord, “These are indeed people given to harmful deeds.”
“March forth with My servants by night, for you are sure to be pursued
“And leave the sea divided, for they are an army destined to be drowned.”
How many were the gardens and springs they left behind
And corn-fields, and impressive buildings
And wealth which they had taken such pride
All this We made other people inherit
And neither heaven nor earth shed a tear over them, nor were they given respite
We did deliver the Children of Israel from a crushing punishment–
Inflicted by Pharaoh, for he was arrogant and one of the transgressors
And We chose them above the nations knowingly
And granted them signs in which there were a manifest trial
As for these, they say humorously
“There is nothing beyond our first death, and we will not be raised again
“Then bring back our ancestors, if what you say is true.”
What, are they better than the people of Touba, and those who were before them? We caused them to perish because they were guilty of harmful deeds
We did not create the heavens, the earth, and all between them, for mere play
We did not create them except for just ends, but most of them do not understand
